Continuous Integration

Note: Change the Institution as required

  • Load Balancer: http://osu.discoveryui.ent.oclc.org/
  • Health Check via Load Balancer (random machine): http://osu.discoveryui.ent.oclc.org/health
  • AMP: http://ovdashboard.ent.oclc.org/amp/amp.cgi?system=DiscoveryUI
  • Logs: http://ovdashboard.ent.oclc.org/amp/amp.cgi?system=DiscoveryUI&command=logFileAnalysis
  • Individual Machines:
    • discoveryuiap01dxdu
      • Webapp: http://osu.discoveryuiap01dxdu.dev.oclc.org:8080
      • HealthCheck: http://ocwms.discoveryuiap01dxdu.dev.oclc.org:8080/health
      • OccWeb: http://discoveryuiap01dxdu.dev.oclc.org:8081
      • JMX: discoveryuiap01dxdu.dev.oclc.org:8086
    • discoveryuiap02dxdu
      • Webapp: http://osu.discoveryuiap02dxdu.dev.oclc.org:8080
      • HealthCheck: http://ocwms.discoveryuiap02dxdu.dev.oclc.org:8080/health
      • OccWeb: http://discoveryuiap02dxdu.dev.oclc.org:8081
      • JMX: discoveryuiap02dxdu.dev.oclc.org:8086

    NOTE: In order to reduce our dependency on EIDM for our CI environment, we have configured Quickbuild to be able to quickly switch between a real implementation of EIDM and a mock one. If you go to our CI configuration in QuickBuild there is a variable in the variables section named imakeupDeployProperties. In this variable we have a special iMakeup command-line argument defined --d ACTIVE_SPRING_PROFILE=PROFILE_NAME

    There are currently two valid values for PROFILE_NAME

    • default - This will use the real EIDM implementation. (i.e. --d ACTIVE_SPRING_PROFILE=default)
    • mock-idm - This will use the mock EIDM implementation. (i.e. --d ACTIVE_SPRING_PROFILE=mock-idm)

    If you change the value and re-run the environment deploy then we will be pointing to the correct EIDM implementation.

Canned Testing

  • discoveryuiap03dxdu
    • Webapp: http://osu.discoveryuiap03dxdu.dev.oclc.org:8080
    • OccWeb: http://discoveryuiap03dxdu.dev.oclc.org:8081
    • JMX: discoveryuiap03dxdu.dev.oclc.org:8086

    This environment is used to perform testing with pre-recorded responses. You can modify the configuration for this project by going to the following url: /switch}http://disctrsap01dxdu.dev.oclc.org:8080/trs2ui/${project.artifactId}/switch

    You can see and re-record all of the responses at this url: /dumpall}http://disctrsap01dxdu.dev.oclc.org:8080/trs2ui/${project.artifactId}/dumpall

    The description of how to configure the TRS correctly should be found here
